prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing birthday greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "A sweet and funny birthday card for my boyfriend who likes PokÃ©mon and working out."
Style: ðŸŽ¨ Watercolor
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Garret
From: J
Message: "Happy Birthday Garret! You can finally rent a car without the extra fees! Sorry I you have to spend your birthday in the state that shall not be named, but who celebrates on their actual birthday anyways. I cannot wait to see you and celebrate your belated birthday with you. You never fail to make me smile, laugh, and the most special thing you do is make me feel confident and loved even on days that I feel low. Basically what Iâ€™m saying is, thx for being born. All my love,
J"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "birthday" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a birthday card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Happy Birthday Garret! You can finally rent a car without the extra fees! Sorry I you have to spend your birthday in the state that shall not be named, but who celebrates on their actual birthday anyways. I cannot wait to see you and celebrate your belated birthday with you. You never fail to make me smile, laugh, and the most special thing you do is make me feel confident and loved even on days that I feel low. Basically what Iâ€™m saying is, thx for being born. All my love,
J" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover:
```json
{
  "frontCover": "Front cover of a birthday greeting card with a watercolor painting style. The scene depicts a muscular, brown, bipedal creature with sharp claws and a determined expression, sitting on a weight bench and lifting a heavy barbell with large, brown weights. Towering behind the creature is a stack of brightly colored gift boxes tied with an orange bow. To the right of the gift stack, a small, yellow, rodent-like creature with large ears and rosy cheeks is cheering enthusiastically, with a stylized lightning bolt symbol behind it. The background is a soft, textured wash of yellow and orange, with faint, blurred outlines of gym equipment like dumbbells and weight racks. The text \"Happy Buff-day!\" is prominently displayed at the top in a playful, brown, hand-drawn font, with \"Happy\" on the first line and \"Buff-day!\" on the second. The overall mood is humorous, energetic, and celebratory, with a warm and inviting color palette. The art style features visible watercolor brush strokes, subtle paper texture, and soft, organic paint bleeds, giving it a charming, hand-painted feel.",
  "backCover": "Back cover of a birthday greeting card with a watercolor painting style, continuing the theme from the front cover. The design is a subtle, artistic conclusion. It features a soft wash of yellow and light orange, reminiscent of the background from the front. Faintly visible in the background are stylized, blurred outlines of gym equipment, such as dumbbells and weight plates, rendered in softer, more muted tones. In the foreground, there are a few small, rounded shapes that suggest resting weight plates, also in a muted watercolor wash. The primary focus is on the texture and color blending, creating a peaceful and serene atmosphere that complements the overall celebratory tone of the card. There is no text or characters on this panel, just a minimalist and artistic evocation of the gym theme.",
  "leftInterior": "Left interior of a birthday greeting card with a watercolor painting style, continuing the visual narrative. The scene is set in a gym environment with a humorous and lighthearted tone. It features a cartoonish, muscular creature, similar to the one on the front cover, but this time it is depicted in a dynamic pose, perhaps doing a bicep curl with an exaggeratedly large dumbbell. Beside it, a smaller, energetic yellow creature is shown giving a thumbs-up. The background is filled with various gym equipment rendered in soft watercolor washes, such as treadmills, weight machines, and exercise balls, all depicted with a playful, slightly distorted perspective. Scattered around the scene are small, stylized gift boxes with bows, some open to reveal colorful abstract shapes. The color palette remains consistent with warm yellows, oranges, and browns, with splashes of accent colors within the gift boxes. The overall composition is lively and engaging, inviting a smile.",
  "rightInterior": "Right interior of a birthday greeting card with a watercolor painting style, designed to beautifully frame the birthday message. The background is a soft, blended wash of warm yellows and light oranges, creating a gentle and inviting atmosphere. Overlaying this wash are delicate, whimsical watercolor illustrations that complement the theme of fitness and celebration. These elements could include abstract shapes that mimic the texture of muscle fibers or energetic brush strokes that suggest movement and strength. Also incorporated are subtle, playful motifs of small, colorful gift boxes scattered artfully, tied with delicate watercolor bows. The main focus is the central area designed to hold the message text. The text is rendered in a warm, friendly brown watercolor font, and it is presented as: \"Happy Birthday Garret! You can finally rent a car without the extra fees! Sorry I you have to spend your birthday in the state that shall not be named, but who celebrates on their actual birthday anyways. I cannot wait to see you and celebrate your belated birthday with you. You never fail to make me smile, laugh, and the most special thing you do is make me feel confident and loved even on days that I feel low. Basically what Iâ€™m saying is, thx for being born. All my love, J\". The artwork surrounding the text is designed to feel integrated and decorative, not just a plain background, creating an artistic and personal presentation of the message."
}
```
generatedPrompts.backCover:
Back cover design for a birthday greeting card with a sweet and funny theme, featuring a watercolor painting style with soft, flowing colors and visible brushstrokes, and a paper texture with organic paint bleeds. The composition is simple and serene, featuring a subtle reference to the front cover's main elements. The primary focus is on a soft, warm, pale yellow background that fades slightly towards the bottom, mimicking the top of the front cover. In the bottom center, a subtly rendered, rounded grey shape, suggestive of the bottom of a kettlebell without the full form of the handle, is present. Tiny, scattered yellow dots, reminiscent of subtle sparkles or pollen, are dotted across the background, mirroring the faint speckled details on the front cover. The overall effect is one of gentle conclusion and peaceful resolution, with no text or characters, and no specific space reserved for a QR code.

generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a birthday greeting card with a humorous, lighthearted tone, depicted in a flat 2D watercolor painting style. The artwork features an "evolution chart" concept for workout equipment, presented with a warm, earthy color palette dominated by golden yellows and light browns, evoking a vintage paper texture with subtle watercolor brush strokes and organic paint bleeds. The scene displays various weights and gym apparatuses in a stylized, charming manner, reminiscent of early educational charts. In the foreground, a pair of dumbbells labeled "Lvl. 1 DUMBBELL" are shown, with an arrow pointing upwards towards another dumbbell, also labeled "Lvl. 1 DUMBBELL" but positioned slightly higher and perhaps more robust. Further up, a complex weightlifting machine, resembling a "GIGA-PRESS" with a seat and multiple weight stacks, is depicted, labeled "Lvl. 100 GIGA-PRESS". Curved, hand-drawn arrows in the same warm watercolor style indicate the progression from the simpler weights to the advanced machine, reinforcing the "evolution" theme in a playful, fitness-focused context. The overall composition is clean and illustrative, allowing ample negative space with a subtle textured background, contributing to the overall charm and humor of the piece.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a birthday greeting card designed for message space with a soft, aged yellow textured paper background. The central area of the page is dedicated to the message, with text clearly legible against the background. The message is framed by a whimsical, repeating border of stylized watercolor elements. These elements include playful, simplified representations of weights, jump ropes, and spherical collectible items with red and white segments, interspersed with small, yellow lightning bolt motifs. The watercolor style is evident in the soft, blended colors and visible brush strokes, creating an organic and artistic feel. The overall composition is balanced, ensuring the decorative elements enhance the message without overwhelming it, and maintaining a lighthearted, humorous, and energetic tone. The colors are warm and inviting, with a palette dominated by muted blues, purples, oranges, and reds, all rendered with a gentle watercolor wash.
